DOC.brief_summary: The aim propose study provide important data weight loss efficacy overweight obese adolescent isocaloric high protein diet v lower protein diet utilizing U.S. Department Agriculture ( USDA ) MyPlate nutrition guide . The investigator hypothesize high protein diet result great weight loss due increase satiety well dietary adherence .
DOC.detailed_description: Aim 1 test efficacy personalize high protein weight loss intervention compare low protein intervention use USDA MyPlate nutrition guide . It hypothesize participant randomly assign high protein dietary treatment lose weight base BMI-Z score 12 week compare participant low dietary protein treatment . Aim 2 test change subjective rating appetite differ dietary treatment ( i.e . protein intake ) . It hypothesize participant higher protein intervention report decrease hunger increase fullness compare participant low protein intervention . Aim 3 test change hexosamine biosynthetic pathway ( HBP ) measure rate limit step glutamine fructose-6-phosphate amidotransferase ( GFAT ) glycosylation measure O-linked N-acetylglucosamine ( GlcNAc ) transferase ( OGT ) differ dietary treatment . It hypothesize participant randomly assign high protein dietary treatment decrease change baseline level GFAT glycosylation ( OGT ) due decrease carbohydrate intake compare low protein treatment . Exploratory Aims : As exploratory aim , investigator test high protein lower protein dietary treatment differentially alter glucose , insulin , cholesterol , triglyceride ( marker metabolic syndrome ) .
DOC.criteria: Be male female Be age 12 17 , inclusive Be 85th BMI percentile ( number calculate participant height , weight , sex , date birth ) Be willing fast 12 hour prior clinic study visit 2 4 Be willing participate research study Health Conditions : Has HIV AIDS Has uncontrolled CVD arrhythmia Has Type I Type II diabetes . Is unable unwilling complete study procedure Participant may qualify study base exclusion criterion list . The study coordinator go information detail . Medications : Diuretics Betablocker Weight loss medication , diet pill Antiinflammatory drug ( corticosteroid/anabolic steroid/NSAID ) Antipsychotic medication Other medication may affect fluid balance weight Lifestyle : â€¢ Plans move study area within next 4 month , plan study area 3 week course study .
